Plato, Meno, In 80D Meno says: “How will you look for it, Socrates, when you do not know at all what it is? How will you aim to search for something you do not know at all? If you should meet it, how will you know that this is the thing that you did not know?” The same difficulty is raised in Theaetetus, 197 et seq.
